newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Optus to sell through Kmart.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Optus to sell through Kmart.

text.p: Australia's second largest telecoms carrier, Optus Communications, said it has reached agreement with retailer Coles Myer Ltd's Kmart division which will see Optus products sold in Kmart stores.
"Optus retail booths will be placed in 20 Kmart stores nationally by the end of November, with plans to extend this to 50 stores by early 1997," Optus said.
The booths will sell and connect Optus mobile phones and accessories as well as Optus calling card and long distance services, Optus said.
Optus said a four-year agreement between the companies was signed after a successful 12-month trial of the booths in 10 Kmart stores around Australia.
Kmart, one of the biggest mass merchandising chain stores in Australia, now has 147 stores in across the country.
Optus is 25 percent owned by Mayne Nickless Ltd and 24.5 percent each by BellSouth Corp of the United States and Cable and Wireless Plc of Britain.
